compliance_reasoning: The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines how a regulated financial entity (AIB life) provides services to consumers. Regulation 121 requires that regulated entities process all instructions from consumers properly and promptly. While the document establishes a framework for the scheme's operation, it does not explicitly address the processing of consumer instructions or specify timeframes for processing such instructions. There is an implied processing of instructions in section 2.1, but no clear statement about how promptly these will be handled.
gap_description: The document lacks explicit provisions regarding the processing of instructions from consumers (members, employers, or trustees) and does not specify timeframes or standards for prompt processing. There is no clear statement about how AIB life will handle instructions, what constitutes 'properly and promptly', or what consumers can expect regarding instruction processing times.
gap_recommendations:
1. Add a specific section addressing how instructions from consumers will be processed, including defined timeframes.
2. Include details on what constitutes 'proper' processing of instructions.
3. Specify the channels through which instructions can be submitted.
4. Add information about confirmation of instruction receipt and processing.
5. Include remedies or compensation if instructions are not processed properly or promptly.
regulation_text: 121. A regulated entity shall process all instructions from or on behalf of a consumer properly and promptly.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
